llm_text:
Why:
- payment_format_ach = 1 strongly increased the model score (SHAP +2.80486), so the ACH payment format is the primary driver of the flag.
- amount_received = 16586.3 increased the score (SHAP +1.14535), indicating the relatively large received amount contributed to the alert.
- dayofweek = 6 (Sunday) increased the score (SHAP +0.71330), so timing on a Sunday was a positive contributor.
- amount_paid = 16586.3 also increased the score (SHAP +0.67415), reinforcing the impact of the transaction size.
- to_bank = 12 increased the score (SHAP +0.45132), meaning the receiving bank ID contributed positively.
- Partially offsetting these, from_bank = 11471 decreased the score (SHAP −0.80765) and hour = 21 (9 PM) decreased the score (SHAP −0.60794), so the originating bank ID and the late-hour timing reduced the model’s suspicion.

Conclusion:
The alert is driven mainly by the transaction being an ACH payment (payment_format_ach) of a relatively large value (amount_received/amount_paid = 16586.3) occurring on a Sunday (dayofweek = 6), with the receiving bank (to_bank = 12) adding further upward contribution. These upward contributions were partly offset by the originating bank (from_bank = 11471) and the late hour (hour = 21). If further review is required, focus checks on the ACH payment details and the receiving bank (to_bank = 12), given those drivers’ positive contributions to the model score.
